text: The Université libre de Bruxelles (; abbreviated ULB) is a French-speaking university in Brussels, Belgium. The university was founded in 1970 as a split from the Free University of Brussels, which was founded in 1834 by the lawyer and liberal politician Pierre-Théodore Verhaegen. It has about 30,000 students. == Other websites == * Official website Category:1970 establishments in Europe Category:1970s establishments in Belgium Category:Colleges and universities in Belgium Category:Organizations based in Brussels
title: Université libre de Bruxelles
